yaml.title: Schedule
yaml.summary: POL 310 schedule with readings, due dates, and links to materials.

markdown.markdown: ```{r packages-data, include=FALSE} library(tidyverse) library(knitr) library(kableExtra) library(lubridate) library(glue) schedule <- read_csv("data/schedule.csv", show_col_types = FALSE) ``` Here you can find the schedule for the semester with links to the list of readings for each week. In addition you'll find links to instructions for the assignments in this course. As a reminder, you are expected to submit a weekly summary for eight weeks in the semester via Canvas before class time on the day the reading was assigned. Here's a guide to the schedule: - [**Materials**](/content/01-intro.qmd) ({{< fa book-open-reader >}}): This page contains the readings and other information (if any) for the entire week. - [**Assignment**](/assignment/) ({{< fa pen-ruler >}}): This page contains the instructions for each assignment. All readings will be made available through the library or on Canvas. ```{r build-table, echo=FALSE, results="asis"} schedule <- schedule %>% mutate(var_title = glue('{title}')) %>% mutate(var_deadline = ifelse(!is.na(deadline), glue('  (submit by {deadline})'), glue(""))) %>% mutate(var_content = ifelse(!is.na(content), glue(''), glue(''))) %>% mutate(var_assignment = ifelse(!is.na(assignment), glue(''), glue(''))) %>% mutate(col_date = ifelse(is.na(date_end), glue('{format(as.Date(date, "%m/%d/%y"), "%B %e")}'), glue('{format(as.Date(date, "%m/%d/%y"), "%B %e")}–{format(as.Date(date_end, "%m/%d/%y"), "%B %e")}'))) %>% mutate(col_title = glue('{var_title}{var_deadline}')) %>% mutate(col_content = var_content, col_assignment = var_assignment) %>% select(Week = week, Date = col_date, Title = col_title, Materials = col_content, Assignment = col_assignment) week_count <- schedule |> count(Week) week_index <- week_count |> pull(n) |> set_names(paste0("Week ", week_count$Week)) tbl <- schedule |> select(-Week) |> kbl(escap = FALSE, align = "rlccc", table.attr = 'class="schedule-table"') |> kable_styling() |> column_spec(1, width = "30%", extra_css = "padding-right: 20px;") |> column_spec(2, width = "50%") |> column_spec(c(3:4), width = "10%") |> pack_rows(index = week_index, label_row_css = "border-bottom: 2px solid #000000;") cat(tbl) ```
